page.title: 02Skellingthorpe Church.
page.content: St Lawrences Church, Skellingthorpe was destroyed by fire in 1916. All that remained after the fire of the original 17th century church were four walls and the square tower. The spire had to be taken down. The church was rebuilt and has remained the same until the present time. There are now plans to build an extention onto the church. The present vicar is the Rev. Ron Kay. There is a church army captain who is Dave Florence. Apart from Sunday services the church is used for weddings and funerals. The people in the church organise clubs and meetings including explorers, pathfinders and Young Peoples Fellowship.
